title: Adventist Health Tulare Data Breach Lawsuit | ClassAction.org
text: Adventist Health Tulare, Signature Performance Data Breach Last Updated on June 13, 2024 At A Glance - What's Going On? - Attorneys need to hear from people impacted by the data breach affecting Adventist Health Tulare as they investigate whether a class action lawsuit can be filed. - What You Can Do - If you got a letter or email about the breach, fill out the form on this page to learn more about the investigation and how you can help. - Does This Cost Anything? - It costs nothing to get in touch or to talk to someone about your rights. - What Can I Get? - If filed and successful, a class action lawsuit could provide consumers with money for any harm resulting from the breach. Data Breach Affecting Adventist Health Tulare: Lawsuit Investigation Attorneys working with ClassAction.org are looking into whether a class action lawsuit can be filed in light of the data breach affecting Adventist Health Tulare. As part of their investigation, they need to hear from individuals who received a notice stating they were impacted. Signature Performance, an agency contracted by Adventist Health Tulare to handle payment collections, recently discovered a data security incident that has impacted over 70,000 patients. Signature Performance detected unusual activity on its network and initiated an investigation with the help of third-party specialists. The investigation revealed that an unknown entity had accessed specific files within the network. This breach reportedly affected 70,802 patients of Adventist Health Tulare, each of whom will receive a personalized notification from Signature Performance detailing the extent of the compromised information, the [health care provider's website states](https://www.adventisthealth.org/news/2024/june/data-breach-by-signature-performance-affecting-adventist-health-tulare-patients/). The data breach affecting Adventist Health Tulare was first reported to the [U.S. Department of Health and Human Services](https://ocrportal.hhs.gov/ocr/breach/breach_report.jsf) on May 31, 2024. If your information was exposed in the breach, attorneys want to hear from you. You may be able to start a class action lawsuit to recover compensation for loss of privacy, time spent dealing with the breach, out-of-pocket costs, and more. A successful case could also force Adventist Health Tulare and Signature Performance to ensure it takes proper steps to protect the information it was entrusted with. Take Action If you received a notice regarding the data breach affecting Adventist Health Tulare, fill out the form on this page to get in touch with us. An attorney or legal representative may then reach out to you to explain more about this investigation and ask you a few questions. Remember, there is no cost to get in touch, and you are under no obligation to take action after speaking to someone. Before commenting, please review our [comment policy](/comment-policy). The information submitted on this page will be forwarded to [Milberg Coleman Bryson Phillips Grossman, PLLC](https://milberg.com/) who has sponsored this investigation. [](#comments) Featured In: Who Is ClassAction.org? ClassAction.org is a group of online professionals who are committed to exposing corporate wrongdoing and giving consumers the tools they need to fight back. We've been reporting on the legal space for nearly a decade and have built relationships with class action and mass tort attorneys across the country.
